title: Notification Toast System
description:
Design a global notification toast system that can be triggered from anywhere in the app (e.g. `toast.success()`, `toast.error()`). Focus on global state management, rendering via portals, stacking multiple toasts, auto-dismiss timers, and accessible behavior.

Functional requirements:
- Expose a simple API like `toast.success(message, options?)`, `toast.error(...)`, `toast.info(...)`.
- Display one or more toast messages over the UI without breaking the layout.
- Support variants (success / error / warning / info) with different visual styles.
- Automatically dismiss toasts after a configurable timeout.
- Allow manual dismiss (close button / click) that cancels the timer.
- Stack multiple toasts in a defined order (e.g. newest on top).
- Support different placements: top-right, top-center, bottom-right, bottom-left; on mobile, optionally full-width.

Non-functional:
- Global API must work from any part of the app without prop-drilling.
- No memory leaks from timers or event listeners (proper cleanup on unmount).
- Correct z-index behavior so toasts appear above regular content but below critical modals if desired.
- Performant even when many toasts are fired in quick succession.
- Good accessibility: ARIA roles, screen reader announcements, focus handling for interactive toasts.

Data / state considerations:
- Each toast has: id, type (success/error/warning/info), message, optional description, createdAt, timeout, placement and optional actions.
- Global toast state is managed in a single place (store, context, or event bus) and rendered through a top-level portal.
- Timers and dismissal logic are tied to toast IDs so that updates/removals are predictable.
